body.p:
Athens Fayette cty Ky June 14th 1862
To his Exelency Beriah Magoffin
Govr of the state of Ky

The undersigned your petitioners would respectfully state to you that at the time of the Feby court for Fayette cty 1861. there was an indictment against Christopher C Stivers for playing at a game of cards and at the present June term of said court. he was fined twenty dollars -- for said offence the facts are about as follows he is not a gamble but was playing for a little past time at 25 cts a game with some associates and we believe that he did not really intend to violate the law in doing so and that his punishment was a malicious thing that he is a peacable quiet law abiding man -- and is a man worth of your clemency and we thereofre petion for a remission of his fine

Levi Hart
M. L. Aubrey
William Ritter
R, C Rogers
Francis Ratcliffe
E. D. Primes
Cornilius Horan
Wm,, Speers
Littlemore Baker
Jersey, Boone
S S Grimes J, P, F, C
F G Anthony
C R Harrison
S L Parker
F M Aubrey
David Starke
H C Aubrey
Barlow Crowder
Milton Hudson
David Sallie
C. Hunley
W J Bery
John Gentry
John. C. Payne
R Literall

Mr Beriah Magoffin it it pleases y the govenor of Kentucky if this petition meets your excelency to Remit it you will pleas lend me the answer to athens
Fayette County Ky

Fayette Cir Ct
$20 } gaming
C C. Stivers
Issd July 22d 1862
